articles.headline: Why Bernie Sanders Is Tough to Beat
articles.snippet: His supporters are loyal, and in Iowa they don’t really have eyes for anyone else.
articles.abstract: His supporters are loyal, and in Iowa they don’t really have eyes for anyone else.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Read more: Bernie Sanders drops out of 2020 democratic presidential race.]

articles.headline: With U.S. Help No Longer Assured, Saudis Try a New Strategy: Talks
articles.snippet: Worried that they can no longer count on American defense, the Saudis have begun talking to their enemies to cool conflicts in the region.
articles.abstract: Worried that they can no longer count on American defense, the Saudis have begun talking to their enemies to cool conflicts in the region.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — In the months since a missile and drone attack widely seen as the work of Iran left two Saudi oil facilities smoldering, the Saudi crown prince has taken an uncharacteristic turn to diplomacy to cool tensions with his regional enemies.
articles.byline: By Declan Walsh and Ben Hubbard

articles.headline: He is Trying to Get Fire Victims Paid. He Has to Find Them First.
articles.snippet: With days left to seek damages from a giant utility, a team fans out in a hard-hit area to get the word to those eligible.
articles.abstract: With days left to seek damages from a giant utility, a team fans out in a hard-hit area to get the word to those eligible.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARADISE, Calif. — Unlike a typical holiday food giveaway, the ham, mashed potatoes and green beans packed in bags at Paradise Alliance Church came with a grim reminder of an even deeper need.

articles.headline: Anguish and Anger From the Navy SEALs Who Turned In Edward Gallagher
articles.snippet: Video interviews and group texts obtained by The Times show men describing their platoon leader in grim terms.
articles.abstract: Video interviews and group texts obtained by The Times show men describing their platoon leader in grim terms.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Watch a special Times documentary featuring combat video and confidential interviews with the Navy SEALs who accused their chief of war crimes, streaming on Hulu.]

articles.headline: China Blocks American Books as Trade War Simmers
articles.snippet: Novels and nonfiction titles alike have been delayed without explanation, cutting off U.S. authors and publishers from a vast market.
articles.abstract: Novels and nonfiction titles alike have been delayed without explanation, cutting off U.S. authors and publishers from a vast market.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — China has taken aim at major American businesses as it looks for ways to retaliate against President Trump’s mounting tariffs. So far it has targeted cars, beef and soybeans — and, apparently, Bob Woodward’s latest tale of Washington dysfunction and intrigue.
articles.byline: By Lin Qiqing and Paul Mozur

articles.headline: Philippine Peasants Were Promised Land. Staking a Claim Can Be Deadly.
articles.snippet: Riding a populist backlash against the elite, President Rodrigo Duterte vowed to rescue landless peasants from poverty. Instead, he has reinforced the monopolistic grip of landowners.
articles.abstract: Riding a populist backlash against the elite, President Rodrigo Duterte vowed to rescue landless peasants from poverty. Instead, he has reinforced the monopolistic grip of landowners.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAGAY CITY, Philippines — On the day the gunman murdered her husband, Elza Balayo was planning a treat for her five children, a fish to accompany the rice that was typically their sole lunch.

articles.headline: The Rikers Coffee Academy
articles.snippet: Can teaching prison inmates to make lattes give them a chance at a better future?
articles.abstract: Can teaching prison inmates to make lattes give them a chance at a better future?
articles.lead_paragraph: Officer Green wanted her vanilla latte piping hot. “With vanilla on top, not a lot, just a drizzle, and very hot, don’t make it warm,” she shouted to Eddie Rodriguez, who was taking orders. He nodded and wrote Green on the side of a cup. “Don’t worry, I got ya. Extra hot for Officer Green.” Then he slid the cup down the bar where Mr. Rodriguez and the other inmates in the barista training program at the Rikers Island prison complex were adding ice, steaming milk and grinding beans to load into a $3,000 Nuova Simonelli espresso machine.
